info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 02 at 10:18PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A HEAVY SNOW BAND WILL AFFECT MERCER...VENANGO...NORTHWESTERN LAWRENCE AND NORTHERN FOREST COUNTIES... At 1017 PM EST, snow showers were located along a line extending from Youngsville to near Cortland. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this snow band. Locations impacted include... Hermitage, Sharon, Oil City, Franklin, Sharpsville, Greenville, Sugarcreek, Farrell, Tionesta, Mercer, Pulaski, and Hasson Heights. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 118 and 138. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 19. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 5. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this intense snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. Icy roads are likely.
